text: Edgar Domingo Evia y Joutard (July 30, 1910 - February 10, 2003) was a Mexican-born American photographer. He took photos for Town & Country, House & Garden, Look, and The New York Times Magazine. Evia was born on July 30, 1910 in Mérida, Yucatán. His father was Mexican, and his mother was French. In 1912, his family immigrated to New York City. Evia was partners with Robert Denning from the 1950s until the 1960s. Then he was partners with David McJonathan-Swarm from 1966 until his death in 2003. Evia died in New York City, New York on February 10, 2003 from pneumonia after a broken hip, aged 92.Information from de Evia's companion, David McJonathan-Swarm, executor of the photographer's estate ==References== ==Other websites== * Edgar de Evia's Official Homepage * Edgar de Evia's biographic sketch at Find A Grave Category:1910 births Category:2003 deaths Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:American photographers Category:American artists Category:People from New York City Category:LGBT artists Category:American LGBT people Category:People from Yucatán (state)
title: Edgar de Evia
